sentences.en: Accustomed to the controls, Burcham came down from high altitude.
sentences.cn: 在适应了操纵装置后, 伯彻姆便从高空俯冲而下.

sentences.en: Nott and Dickinson set a new altitude record when they ascended 55,900 feet in their balloon.
sentences.cn: 诺特和迪金森乘坐热气球上升了55，900英尺，创造了一项新的高度纪录。

sentences.en: Particle concentrations in the upper atmosphere drop regularly as the altitude rises.
sentences.cn: 在高层大气中粒子浓度随高度的增加而有规律地下降.

sentences.en: Slowly the little plane gained altitude and headed out to sea.
sentences.cn: 这架小小的飞机慢慢地愈飞愈高,向海上飞去.

sentences.en: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.
sentences.cn: 那架飞机已经达到了大约三万九千英尺的巡航高度。

sentences.en: The airplane kept on flying at a high altitude.
sentences.cn: 这架飞机继续在高空飞行.

sentences.en: The mountain has an altitude of 1,500 metres.
The mountain has an altitude of 10 , 000 ft.
The pilot decided to land, but as we lost altitude the wind became stronger.
sentences.cn: 飞行员决定着陆，但随着我们越飞越低，风变得越来越大。

sentences.en: The plane can fly at a maximum altitude of 75,000 feet.
sentences.cn: 飞机最高飞行度为七万五千??.

sentences.en: The plane flew at an altitude of 20, 000 feet.
sentences.cn: 这架飞机在两万英尺的高空飞行.

sentences.en: The plane was flying at an altitude of 2000 meters.
sentences.cn: 这时飞机的高度是2000公尺.

sentences.en: The plane was grabbing for altitude.
The plane was then flying at an altitude of 8000 feet.
sentences.cn: 当时飞机在八千英尺的高度飞行.

sentences.en: What is the altitude of the top of the mountain?
sentences.cn: 这座山的顶峰海拔是多少?

sentences.en: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.--Zig Ziglar
sentences.cn: 决定你人生高度的，不是你的才能，而是你的态度。

trans.tran_en: the height of an object or place above the sea
